event: Lucayan Taíno people settle the islands from Hispaniola and Cuba.
Christopher Columbus makes landfall on San Salvador Island, the first European contact with the New World.
Spanish explorers enslave and deport most of the Lucayan population to work in Hispaniola.
English Puritans from Bermuda, known as the Eleutheran Adventurers, settle on Eleuthera.
Bahamas becomes a British Crown colony to combat rampant piracy.
Woodes Rogers appointed first Royal Governor; suppresses piracy.
American Loyalists settle in the Bahamas following the American Revolutionary War, bringing enslaved Africans.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire; former enslaved people granted freedom.
Duke of Windsor (former King Edward VIII) appointed Governor of The Bahamas.
Internal self-government granted under a new constitution.
Lynden Pindling becomes the first Black Premier; beginning of majority rule.
The Bahamas gains full independence from the United Kingdom on July 10, remains in the Commonwealth.
Tourism and banking emerge as dominant sectors in the economy.
Free National Movement wins elections; Hubert Ingraham becomes Prime Minister.
Hurricane Dorian devastates the Abaco Islands and Grand Bahama, causing widespread destruction.
COVID-19 pandemic severely impacts tourism and economy.
